snippet: Sociologists say that companies are realizing that productivity goes up if employees feel like they can put smartphones down once they leave the workplace.
abstract: Some companies are realizing that workers who are asked to stay in constant smartphone contact become burnt out and less productive; sociologists contend that even small breaks from connectivity can significantly improve performance and job satisfaction.
lead_paragraph: Sociologists say that companies are realizing that productivity goes up if employees feel like they can put smartphones down once they leave the workplace.

headline.seo: Companies See Benefit of Time Away From Mobile Devices
headline.main: The Workplace Benefits of Being Out of Touch
headline.print_headline: The Workplace Benefits of Being Out of Touch
